page.title: 14SHELDON MANOR
page.content: {SHELDON MANOR}IS A BEAUTIFUL {PLANTAGENET}MANORHOUSE .IT WAS BUILT BY{SIR GEOFFREY GASELYN}IN THE{13th CENTURY. THE PORCH WAS BUILT ABOUT {1282.}THE EAST WING WAS BUILT IN{1431 AND THE WEST WING WAS BUILT IN{1659. THERE WAS A{MEDIEVAL VILLAGE}AT SHELDON. IN{1287}THERE WERE 13 HOUSES. THE VILLAGE HAD DISAPPEAERD BY{1582. THERE ARE 18 ROOMS ,330 ACRES (OF WHICH 250 ARE LET),A HERD OF COWS A LLAMA, 24 SHEEP,AND VARIOUS DUCKS AND CHICKENS.FOR THE LAST 8 YEARS THERE HAS BEEN A{SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL}IN THE MANOR GROUNDS,WHICH WERE DESIGNED BY MAJOR GIBBS,WHO ALSO HAS A SPLENDID COLLECTION OF{GLASS}CANES.THE GARDENS AND HOUSE ARE OPEN TO THE PUBLIC.AN OLD STABLE BLOCK HAS BEEN CONVERTED INTO TEA ROOMS.FOOD IS PREPARED IN THE MANOR BY MRS. ELSIE GIBBS.FINALLY THE MANOR BOASTS A 15th CENTURY{CHAPEL.
